page.title: 17LLANGURIG, RELIGION
page.content: A typical Welsh village which was once strongly religious but now the local churches suffer from dwindling support. St Curig's Church holds a service every Sunday at 10 a.m. and at the moment has a strong Sunday School. The Ebenezer chapel holds a service every Sunday and only one in four is in English, which must be counter-productive. The Wesleyan Methodist chapel holds infrequent services. The congregations in all three are small. There is no resident minister in the village. The village school belongs to no religious denomination, but readily supports the local churches in charitable fund raising when required.
